intro: Stenanthemum waterhousei, commonly known as the Waterhouse's stenanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in heathland and rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowering period occurs during the cooler months, attracting various pollinators such as bees and birds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in native gardens.
